titleStmt.title: SII 14.226: original edition by A. S. Ramanatha Ayyar
No. 226. (A.R. No. 21 of 1927.) VIJAYANĀRĀYAṆAM, NANGUNERI TALUK, TIRUNELVELI DISTRICT. ON THE SOUTH WALL OF THE RĀJAGŌPĀLASVĀMIN TEMPLE.

summary.p: This inscription dated in the 10th year of Śrīvallabha is incomplete and refers to some transactions made in the 31st year of Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva, ‘who took Kollam’, relating to the temples of Varaguṇa-viṇṇagar-Āḻvār, Śaṭhagōpa-viṇṇagar Āḻvār and Śrī Rāghavachakravartigaḷ.
Vijayanārāyaṇa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam is stated to be a brahmadēya in Nāṭṭāṟṟuppōkku and a certain Śaṅkaraṉ Vāsudēvaṉ of Turuttimaṅgalam is said to have been a person of note in the place (vide No. 231).

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svastiśrī . tirumaṭantaiyum jayamaṭantaiyum tiruppuyaṅkaḷil Iṉitiruppa Irunilamum perumai Etta Eṇṭicaiyuṅ kuṭai ṉṉavarellām vantiṟaiñca van=ta maṇimuṭicūṭi teṉkumariyum vaṭakaṅkaiyum tiraikkaṭale Ellaiyākap pārmuḻutuṅ kayalāṇai parantu ceṅkol Uṭaṉ vaḻara maṉṉiya virasiṅhāsaṉattu Ulakamuḻutuṭai yāroṭum
viṟṟiruntaruḷiya māmutal matikkulam komutal koccaṭaiyapaṟmarāṉa tirupuvaṉaccakkaravarttikaḷ śrīvallapatevaṟku yāṇṭu 10vatu tulānāyaṟu nāṭṭāṟṟu pokku brahmadeyam vicayanārāyaṇac caruppetimaṅkalattu mutalittarañ ceyki ṟa turuttimaṅkalattuc caṅkaraṉ vāsudevaṉum Ivvūr sabhaiyuṅkūṭa Iruntu Uḷḷūr tevarkaḷukku Iṟaiyili viṭṭa
lakaḷukkum kkum vaṟṟirkum tirumukappaṭi tirukoyil kuṟip paṭiyum Iṟaiili viṭṭa nilaṅ kollam � ṇṭāṉ śrī kolottuṅka coḷatevaṟku yāṇṭu 3 10 1 I 3 10 1 Āṇṭu mutal tarattu śrīcaṭakopa viṇṇakarāḷvārkku � kṣam śrīvarakuṇa viṇṇakarāḷvārkku � m � m śrīrākava cakravarttikaḷukku �
�ta ma l nta mākāṇikku Iraṇṭāntarattu � Iṟai mākkāṇiyum Ivvūr Epperppaṭṭatum cantirātittavaṟ celuttuka Eṉṟu Eḻutiṉamaikku Ivai centaṉākaraiyaṉ Eḻutteṉṟum vikkiramaṉ karamaṉ Eḻutteṉṟum cūlapāṇi kaṇṭaṉ Eḻutteṉṟum IravikumaraṉThe inscription stops here.
